result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn M Tevz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Restitution is ordered in the amount of $7,673.80.  Defendant has paid $1,000 prior to sentencing (balance owed of $6,673.80).  Restitution is ordered payable to CJ & Associates and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines/surcharges as a Condition of Probation.

Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with CJ & Associates, Inc. or any of their employees.
No contact with any pawn shops or salvage yards.
Defendant not to be involved in the scrapping business.
Defendant to contact probation and parole by 09:00 a.m. on 12-19-2016.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 60 DAYS:  To be served non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.  Court will grant release for purposes of his methodone program and elder care for grandfather.
Defendant to report to Huber by 07:00 p.m. on 12-212016.  (Original report date was 12-19-2016.  Court granted request for defendant to report on 12-21-2016 by 07:00 p.m.).
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
LAST 60 DAYS:  Stayed - to be used at the agent's discretion.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Shannon Tenney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Shawn M Tevz in court with attorney Kirk Andrew Redetzke.   
Court will also address restitution (Restitution requested is $6,673.80)

Court will address the Restitution issue first.
Witness called:  Curt Rudy (CEO of CJ and Associates, Inc.) and Russell Prochnow (Defense investigator).
Sworn and testified.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations to the court.
Defendant's father presented a statement to the court.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  8 Years.
Initial Confinement: 3.5 Years.
Extended Supervision:  4.5 Years.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:   4 Years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with: CJ & Associates, Inc. or any of their employee; any pawn shops or salvage yards.
Defendant not to be involved in the scrapping business.
DNA sample to be provided.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by the agent.
Defendant to contact probation by 9 am on Monday, 12/19/16.

RESTITUTION:  $6,673.80 ($1,000 pre paid by the defendant), (to be paid to CJ & Associates - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
120 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions, court will grant release for purposes of his methodone program and elder care for grandfather).
First 60 Days to be served - Defendant to report to Huber by 7 pm on Monday 12/19/16.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Last 60 Days - STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.
